name: Holiday Inn London - Heathrow Ariel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfectly fine hotel, nice staff, helpful. 20 Pound cab ride fo a close place. Buy a 4 pound bus ticket to the airport fromthe machine in the lobby. Hotel will give schedule. Nice pub in lobby offered to charge myVisa in Pounds or dOLLARS. MOST CONVENIENT.
reviews.title: Got a little more than I paid for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this hotel is near the airport. It was very quiet and the rooms were very confortable. Its close enough to some things. Its at the end of the free zone that was nice. Bad thing is no pool or hot tub
reviews.title: nice hotel

reviews.text: [The Good]
reviews.title: False advertising, Poor Service, Shabby tiny room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - It's close to Heathrow airport
reviews.title: Will be back.

reviews.text: [The Bad]
reviews.title: Good for locaton bad for service

reviews.text: Is it a 3 star hotel? Maybe, just maybe. Rooms very small, breakfast oily and tasteless. Biggest problem for me was the bathroom. The toilet flush needed a fit person with massive muscle power to flush the toilet. Just could not budge the strange looking handle. How do they expect children and elderly to cope? The bath was stained with years of dripping taps. The shower control were difficult to move too.
reviews.title: Very Average. Dull place

reviews.text: Bed was comfortable. Thats about it all.
reviews.title: OK by UK standards but poor otherwise

reviews.text: Avoid if you can,
reviews.title: Find some where else , dont stay

reviews.text: By UK standards, a nice hotel. By Canadian / continental European / U.S. standards, a poor hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, comfortable room, very close to Heathrow

reviews.text: Good: (1) bus connection (the local buses from and to the terminals are for free and stop around New Road, a five-minute walk from the hotel; ask the bus driver for the Sheraton Skyline -- alternatively you can also take the faster Hoppa shuttle that costs four pounds each way), (2) the quality of the breakfast (a nice buffet that includes cereals, toast, croissants, pain au chocolat, fresh fruit and vegetables, and more traditional local items such as Cumberland sausage or back bacon), (3) overall, the room was clean for the most part, (4) the price was good (approx. 60 Canadian dollars = 47 euros = 39 pounds), (5) the fact that other comparatively priced hotels in the area are most likely equally poor.
reviews.title: possibly the worst hotel near an airport I have ever stayed at

reviews.text: Stayed for one night as part of park and stay offer for 8 nights. Staff very friendly and helpful and obtained a complimentary drink from the bar and free breakfast the following morning.
reviews.title: Small room, but comfortable for one night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was an inner room and was very small. Fine for one night, but any more and would be too much. Single bed was not especially comfortable but helped me get up early and sleep on the plane (Heathrow to Newark).
reviews.title: I wouldn't suggest this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking was a little concern as I was initially asked to hand my keys in case the car would have to be moved to another site (fortunately this did not happen as I was not asked for the car keys at check out. I would probably recommend the Crowne Plaza as it has better rooms, better facilities and more parking spaces, but if price is an issue the the Holiday Inn Aerial is ideal. The staff are very welcoming and courteous
reviews.title: you get what you pay for.

reviews.text: The only thing this hotel has going for it is it's proximity to Heathrow and that the sheets were clean. The bathroom was marginally clean, as was the rest of the room. The warmest the shower got was lukewarm, which after a long day of traveling was terribly disappointing. The food in the restaurant was really sub-par and very expensive, which I suppose is to be expected in that location. The hallways leading to our room were dimly lit and very shabby/bleak. Would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Very Good Value

reviews.text: Have stayed at this hotel many times just to be near the airport as we always have to be there by 6am for a 9am flight , i have always found our rooms to be clean and the staff accommodating and the price is great this march a got a room for 35pounds , i would not recommend this hotel for more than a one nights stay but for the convenience you can not beet it .
reviews.title: Great for an airport stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A typical airport hotel with convenient transportation to the airport. No free shuttle bus, but it is possible to reach by public bus from Terminal 1 (bus stop near the hotel in the free zone.) With more storage you can use the service to the airport Hoppa (£ 4 per person). Room typical chain hotels Holiday Inn - quite big, clean and bright. Clean bathroom, bathtub without a separate shower cubicle. Checkin and checkout quickly and easily. I recommend for people with early flights or arriving late.
reviews.title: Good hotel near LHR airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night before our fight to Athens. The hotel is located about a 20 min bus ride from the airport and there is a hopper bus sevies to all the terminals which costs £4 for a single. The room was not the best but it was clean (a bit tatty). The main problem was that our room was next to the runway and every 5 min you could planes taking off. There was an extra pane of glass to each window to try and limit the noise-it didn't work. We also had girls running up and down the corrider outside the room most of the night.
reviews.title: ok-but not the best

reviews.text: Staff very friendly and helpful and comfortable beds/pillows, but I would not recommend a stay in this hotel if you require a decent nights sleep prior to an early flight and busy holiday.
reviews.title: Ok price and good location

reviews.text: I stayed at Heathrow Ariel Holiday Inn on November 6 while en route to Eastern Europe. It's a small hotel very close to the Heathrow airport (HOPPA bus # 6). The hotel can also arrange a cab for &9 pounds one way, which may be preferable for early morning flights as the HOPPA bus comes every half hour.
reviews.title: just good

reviews.text: My room was rather small but ok for a short stay. Both room and bathroom were clean and reasonably comfortable. Restaurant (dinner) was overpriced but then again, most things are in England.
reviews.title: Not your typical Holiday Inn you come to get used to

aka: Holiday Inn London - Heathrow Ariel Hotel
description: The Holiday Inn London Heathrow Ariel is located conveniently just minutes away from London Heathrow Airport with the new Terminal 5. We are a short ride on the Heathrow Express from Central London. Being the first Airport Hotel at Heathrow we know what it takes to make it feel 'home from home'. We offer our guest's designed blackout rooms with double glazed windows to help with a good nights sleep and a fresh start before your meeting or a long flight. The Holiday Inn London Heathrow Ariel offers Airport Parking at very competitive rates. Either flying for business or leisure, you can benefit from our Park and Fly package All the bedrooms and the public area have Air Conditioning and HSIA (High Speed Internet Access) The Holiday Inn London Heathrow Ariel offers a fully equipped, purpose built conference centre for your meeting and training needs. The Airport Shuttle operated by BAA & National Express, Hotel Hoppa H6 runs to & from the hotel and Heathrow Airport terminals 1, 2 & 3 and Hotel Hoppa H56 runs to & from the hotel and Heathrow Airport terminals 5 every 15 minutes everyday. Adult price is 4.00 per person one way. From Terminal 4, take the Heathrow Express (Free) to T1, 2 & 3 and then take the Airport Shuttle as above. Kids Stay & Eat Free* *Terms and Conditions apply.
